summary.text:
keymash/react - React bindings for keymash

Provides a
`useKeymash`
hook for declarative keyboard binding in React components.

Extended handler context for React bindings.
Includes
`setResult`
to trigger re-renders with custom state.

Set a result value that will be available in the hook's return.
Calling this triggers a re-render with the new result.
The keyboard event that triggered the binding
The Keymash instance that triggered the binding

Handler function for React key combo bindings.
Receives extended context with
`setResult`
for triggering re-renders.
Extended sequence handler context for React bindings.
The matched sequence string
The Keymash instance that triggered the sequence
Handler function for React sequence bindings.
A binding configuration for React useKeymash hook.
The key combination (bigint bitmask)
Function to call when the combo is triggered
Human-readable label for the binding
Delay in milliseconds before firing the handler
Whether to fire on key repeat
A sequence binding configuration for useKeymash.
The character sequence to match (e.g., "show me")
Handler called when sequence is typed
Timeout in ms before buffer resets (default: 1000)
Information about which binding was triggered.
The combo that was triggered
Human-readable combo text
The binding's label (if provided)
Timestamp when triggered
Options for the useKeymash hook.

Element or ref to scope bindings to.
Events only fire when originating from within this element.
Bindings to register. Handlers receive
`{ event, instance, setResult }`

.
When bindings change, all are re-registered to ensure handlers stay current.
Sequence triggers to register.

Whether the keymash should be active (listening for keyboard events).

**Default behavior:**
-
`true`
if
`bindings`

array is provided and non-empty
-
`false`
if no bindings are provided (you must call
`setActive(true)`
manually)
Human-readable label for debugging.

Callback for real-time key state updates.
Useful for building keyboard visualizers.
Return type for the useKeymash hook.

The underlying Keymash instance.
Will be
`null`
on first render if using a ref-based scope.
Whether the keymash is currently active
Activate or deactivate the keymash
Current key state mask (for visualizers)
Check if a specific key/combo is currently pressed.

Information about the most recently triggered binding.
Resets to null after each render cycle.
The result value set by the most recent handler via
`setResult`

.
Use this to react to binding triggers in your component.

Imperatively bind a key combo.
Prefer declarative bindings via options when possible.
Imperatively unbind a key combo.

Register a sequence trigger imperatively.
Returns an unsubscribe function.
Get all active bindings from this instance.

React hook for declarative keyboard bindings.

Handlers receive
`{ event, instance, setResult }`
. Call
`setResult(value)`

to
trigger a re-render and make the value available via the
`result`
return property.

content.text: Object with instance, state, triggered info, and result

summary.text: Configuration options

Hook to get the current key state mask without registering bindings.

Returns a bigint bitmask representing currently pressed keys. Use bitwise AND
with
`hold.*`
or
`press.*`

values to check specific key states. This hook
creates an internal keymash instance scoped to the provided element.

Useful for components that only need to read key state (e.g., showing visual
indicators) without handling keyboard shortcuts.

content.text: Current key state as a bigint bitmask

summary.text: Element, Window, or React ref to scope key listening to. Defaults to
`window`

Represents a binding from a specific keymash instance,
including metadata about the instance.
The keymash instance this binding belongs to
Label of the keymash instance (for grouping in UI)
Whether the keymash instance is currently active
The key combo bitmask
Human-readable combo text (e.g., "ctrl+s")
Handler function for this binding
Optional label for this specific binding
Delay in ms before handler fires
Whether this binding fires on key repeat

Hook to get all bindings from all keymash instances.
Useful for building keyboard shortcuts dialogs or help panels.

content.text: Array of GlobalBinding objects from all active keymash instances

summary.text:
Object containing hold (modifier) key masks. Use these for keys that should be
held down as part of a chord. Includes common modifiers and aliases.

Object containing press key masks. Use these for the key that triggers the binding.
Includes letters, numbers, special keys, and function keys.

Object containing physical key code masks for layout-independent bindings.
Use these when you need bindings based on physical key position rather than
the character produced (e.g., WASD game controls that work on any keyboard layout).

Helper for binding keys that aren't in the standard set, like media keys or
custom key codes.

content.text: Object with hold and press bigint masks for the key

summary.text: The key name (e.g., 'MediaPlay', 'MediaPause')
Shorthand for
`hold.ctrl`
. Use with
to build key combos.
Shorthand for
`hold.shift`
. Use with
to build key combos.
Shorthand for
`hold.alt`
. Use with
to build key combos.
Shorthand for
`hold.meta`
(Cmd on Mac, Win on Windows).
Alias for
`meta`
. Shorthand for
`hold.meta`
(Cmd on Mac).
Alias for
`meta`
. Shorthand for
`hold.meta`
(Win on Windows).

Get all currently instantiated (not destroyed) Keymash instances.
Useful for building keyboard shortcuts dialogs.

content.text: Set of all active Keymash instances

summary.text:
Subscribe to changes in any keymash instance (creation, destruction, binding changes).
Returns an unsubscribe function.
Function called when any keymash instance changes

The main Keymash class that manages keyboard bindings for a specific scope.
Create instances using the
keymash
factory function.
Human-readable label for debugging

content.text: The element that all handlers are attached to.
Events are actually bound to the window, but they are filtered by containment on this element if provided.

summary.text: Array of all registered bindings

Add bindings - supports multiple overloads:
- bind(binding: Binding) - single binding object
- bind(bindings: Binding[]) - array of bindings
- bind(combo: KeyCombo, handler: KeyComboHandler) - shorthand
Remove binding(s) for the given combo(s).

Activate or deactivate event listeners.
Note: Listeners are always attached to window, but events are filtered
based on whether the configured target contains the event target.
Subscribe to changes. Returns an unsubscribe function.
Set a callback for real-time key state updates (for visualizers).
Check if the keymash is currently active.
Destroy the keymash instance, removing all listeners.

Register a sequence trigger. Fires handler when the typed sequence is detected.
Returns an unsubscribe function.
The character sequence to match (e.g., "show me")
Function called when sequence is matched
Optional configuration { timeout?: number }
Factory function to create a new Keymash instance.
Optional configuration object

Gets all active bindings from a target element or Keymash instance.
Returns an array of FullBindings with resolved properties and human-readable combo text.

content.text: Array of FullBinding objects with resolved properties

summary.text: Target to get bindings from (defaults to window)

A key combination represented as a bigint bitmask.
Create using hold and press objects with + and | operators.

Context object passed to key combo handlers.
Using an object parameter allows for future extensibility and cleaner destructuring.
The keyboard event that triggered the binding
The Keymash instance that triggered the binding

Handler function for key combos. Called when a binding is triggered.
Receives a context object with the event and instance.

A keyboard binding configuration. Defines what key combination triggers
a handler and optional metadata.
The key combination (bigint bitmask)
Function to call when the combo is triggered
Human-readable label for the binding
Delay in milliseconds before firing the handler
Whether to fire on key repeat

A binding with all optional properties resolved to their default values,
plus a human-readable combo text string.
The key combination (bigint bitmask)
Function to call when the combo is triggered
Human-readable label for the binding
Delay in milliseconds before firing the handler
Whether to fire on key repeat
Human-readable combo text (e.g., "ctrl+s")
Context object passed to sequence handlers.
The matched sequence string
The Keymash instance that triggered the sequence

Handler function for sequence triggers. Called when a typed sequence matches.
Receives a context object with the sequence and instance.
Configuration object for creating a Keymash instance via the factory function.

The scope element for this keymash.
Events are captured at window level but only processed if the event
originated from within this element (or window for global capture).
Initial bindings to register
Combo to activate this keymash (not yet implemented)
Combo to deactivate this keymash (not yet implemented)
Human-readable label for debugging

Public interface for Keymash instances. Describes all methods and properties
available on a Keymash instance.
Human-readable label for debugging
The scope element for this keymash. Events are filtered by containment.
Array of all registered bindings
Add keyboard bindings. Supports shorthand syntax or full binding objects.
Remove binding(s) for the given combo(s)
Activate or deactivate event listeners
Subscribe to changes. Returns an unsubscribe function.

Register a sequence trigger. Fires handler when the typed sequence is detected.
Returns an unsubscribe function.
Check if the keymash is currently active (listening for events)

Set a callback for real-time key state updates (for visualizers).
Called with the current bitmask whenever keys are pressed or released.
Destroy the keymash instance, removing all listeners
Internal state tracking for currently held keys.
Set of currently held key names

readme.text:
# KeyMash

Keyboard shortcuts that just work. No string parsing. No modifier key bugs. No scope conflicts.

](https://zetlen.github.io/keymash/#usage) | Full library with sequences, introspection, and dev warnings | 2.86 KB |
| [

](https://zetlen.github.io/keymash/#usage) | Minimal core for basic keyboard bindings only | 1.07 KB |
| [

](https://zetlen.github.io/keymash/#react) | React hooks for declarative keyboard binding | 1.27 KB |
<!-- MODULES_TABLE_END -->

## Documentation

Full documentation, interactive demo, and API reference at **[zetlen.github.io/keymash](https://zetlen.github.io/keymash/)**.
